caption: The food is delicious and the portions are generous. We love the Barlwy soup, the Pierogis, the Beef Goulash and the Potato pancakes. Next time we will try the stroganoff.
Best chicken cutlet dinner.  I've been ordering from them for 15 years.  Its perfect every time. Love their potato pancakes too! And pierogies.

I've been in the neighborhood for over a year but didn't get to visit this gem, until recently. They have a huge selection of food, from a hot bar to pizza and a grand selection of fresh Italian baked goods. We ordered some rainbow cookies and a black and white. I have to say, those cookies were some of the best I've had of any bakery. The cookies were soft, the ingredients were fresh and they didn't leave us with that "heavy" feeling you usually get after treating yourself. I don't want to forget to add that the staff was great.
Food is amazing and alot.....def get the Hungarian Pancakes.....

Finished my leftovers just now. Still fantastic. Polonica has consistently provided delicious meals that feel home cooked and healthy, even despite getting the perogies fried. Their 5 pickled veggies assortment (included with entrees) are tasty and balance out my meal. My favorite things to order are the Stuffed Chicken and the Hungarian Pancakes. The owners are friendly and the restaurant is clean and well-maintained.  Update: Still consistently on our takeout list. We added pierogies to our regular order. Every guest that has eaten here with us has raved about how good it is. It's the kind of place that, were you to move away from Bay Ridge, you would plan a visit just to eat here again. Service and quality have been unwaveringly excellent.
Is so delicious we order atleast 1 times per month
Excellent food. Friendly staff/owners. All around perfect experience!!
The best. Love this restaurant!! Best perogies hands down!
Absolutely perfect food. Stellar service. I love the beef stroganoff and the roast beef, my favorites. The beef melts in your mouth and tastes like heaven
Great food, great service. Everything is fresh and portions are a nice size. Love this place.

I like this restaurant so so much. Everything delicious. I order food from them very often.  But I don’t like your service. Your service is very poor. You have NEVER gave me napkins, spoons or forks. I gave you 3 stars, I know that your restaurant deserve 5 stars, but customer service is very important!!!!!!!!
Always delivers on a great homestyle meal experience
The pottato pancales are sooo good, my wife loved the  Pierogies and the stuffed cabbage as well! We will definitlely  return . You guys rock!!!!!!

I think it’s a joke all that good reviews or the owner spending his time to write them!!! It’s probably was the worse experience! Disgusting food!! Pierogi .... there buy them in store and cannot even clock it normal !! Just regular cheap pierogi from store for 3.99. I would never go I would never recommend!!! I was very surprise!!!  DISGUSTING
Excellent Polish cuisine
The worst food ever 👎 the restaurant is not well kept (it’s dirty and unkempt), and the food reeks as if it was rotten.

I ordered the combination Polish platter and Ukrainian borscht, and it was all delicious! The food was delivered very quickly, and was still piping hot when it arrived. So glad they've opened for takeout and delivery during the current pandemic.
Excellent!!! Been going since they opened in 1991. The food is absolutely delish!!
Grate Polish food
We have placed an order over the phone and have waited over 2 hours, yes over 2 hours and when the food came it was cold and disgusting not recommended!
My go to Polish restaurant in Bay Ridge. I went with the combo plate this time. Try the red borscht soup with dumplings, it's very good.

Plan to add 100 reps around the block to your exercise routine as the food is so delicious you'll want to try everything. Start with a variety of cheese or veg perogies and save room for the blintzes. Big enough to share or carry out one for later.
This restaurant is amazing!! The service was great, the food was authentic and delicious. I highly recommend!
Very slow service
Amazing food
Awsome
Best place to eat eastern European  food.
The stuffed cabbage is great done in a tomato sauce.  The house salad is actually five different salads and is practically a meal all by itself.  The borscht with dumplings is also very good.
Delicious Polish and Eastern European classics. Glad to have it so close by. Food might take some time to leave the kitchen, but it's worth the wait.

Best part of driving from outside of Boston to Bay Ridge, other than my son and his family, is this restaurant!! We make sure to either order out or go there every time! My husband grew up in a Polish household and swears by Polonica! Can’t wait to get back!
Love this place....real home comfort meals
Hands down the most delicious pierogies in NYC. Wonderful atmosphere with sweet and attentive service.
Great food, tastes like good home cooking! Friendly service, relaxed atmosphere!
Excellent food and service. Had a great lunch here. Get lots of perogies!

Genuine and authentic. They recently expanded into a nice, new place on 3rd Ave and 83rd Street. Food is excellent and will be loved by any palette. All traditional Polish dishes on the menu. Must try their golabki (cabbage rolls) and traditional kielbasa dishes. Dont pass this one without coming in for a delicious meal.

Really good food. The waitstaff is very grumpy and hostile though which is unfortunate. The portions are generous on the food but the pours on the wine are tiny and not worth the money. I'd definitely go back in spite of this because the food was excellent but frankly I'd rather order it in instead of dealing with the waitstaff.

Very disappointing experience and I've been to Poland many times! I came with my SO on an early Friday evening. The place looked clean but empty and dark (that should have stopped me). After the confirmation from the waiter that the place was opened we took a table and ordered. The food was AT BEST OKAY and I frankly do not understand where all the praise is coming from! But the worst part was the service: we had a male waiter, who seemed to be very unwilling to serve us: no pleasantries or smiles, absent for the most of our time there. When I saw him, I asked to pack our dessert to go, so he just brought a container and left it there staring at me. He also dropped a plastic bag on an oily plate. I HAD TO PACKAGE THE DESSERT MYSELF while he was just standing there and I HAD TO ASK HIM to bring another plastic bag because the one he dropped was already dirty. Who does that?! - Never coming back.
The pierogies here are worth the trip alone! Great prices and amazing polish food! The kielbasa was amazing!
The borsch is soooooo delicious!
Every dish was delicious!
The pierogis are the bomb man. Their vegetable salads are also great
Delicious
Love the Soups !!!
Outstanding food incredibly inexpensive. It's a must do!!!
Food was amazing
Awesome atmosphere! The service is outstanding too. Food is delicious and fresh.
My go-to Polish restaurant. Always a great meal, large selection of authentic delicacies.
Delicious food, tastes like a home cooked meal.  Everyone is friendly, really good prices.
Delicious home made food with generous portion
Great food, huge portions, very reasonable prices.
Good home-made Polish food, generous portions.
Friendly fast service
Nice atmosphere, and good soups. Water served in dirty glasses.
Awesome service
Foods awesome. If you have never had polish food don't worry you will love it.
Comfort food at it's finest

Great food,  highly recommend! Beautiful decor and outstanding service. If you want to have a good and romantic dinner this is the place to visit. The waitress was very attentive with a great  knowledge of polish food .We’ll definitely return.
Just delicious: white borzh, ryzy! BIG portions. Share
Tasty food with many vegetarian options.  Friendly service, pleasant decor.
Totally enjoyable ..delicious pierogies.. nice place
The Best.
The place for Polish food in Bay Ridge.
Delicious food that will have me returning often.  Very quaint dining.  Everything is truly home made and made to order.  Just delightful.
Great food. Service needs to improve, especially when it's not that crowded.
The food and ambiance of this place is perfect. The food was what I expected and more. I would definitely  recommend this place to anyone.
This is not what I expect to be , ask chicken parmigiana and it is not a real one , is stuffed flour

All the food it’s delicious 😍 everything was fresh. The owners are amazing, really friendly and warm, I recommend this place if you want to try something new and delicious. I will Definitely come back.
One of the few polish restaurants in bay ridge, recently relocated but has a long standing good reputation in the neighborhood. Byob until further notice
Fabulous kielbasa! Try it!
All food was oversold
(Translated by Google) Yummmmm! Periogiessssss!  (Original) Yummmmm!  Periogiessssss!
Delicious

New Location but the food is still amazing! Really nice and open area , with a cute design for the place! The food is reallly good and always has been. This is the best polish restaurant in brooklyn. Have been coming here since its old location and it does not disappoint! This is REAL polish food!
The best Polish restaurant on Bay Ridge
Fantastic Polish food!  Try the Ukranian borscht.   The best I've ever had!
Please with the Polish food my favorite
Greatest restaurant which I ever tried the food is also deeply mini and the cabasa the greatest ever delicious dish
Great food
Good food... it's bring  your own... but it was good.. service wad good as well
Amazing, authentic food and an excellent service in this family owned gem. The new location is so much better! looking forward to the back patio in the summer.
Love it
I love this place! The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly. I reccomend this restaurant to anyone who loves the authentic polish food.
Service was a little dodgy, but it added to the charm. Felt like I was eating in someone's home. Everything we ordered was excellent and flavorful. The Hungarian pancake is highly recommended.

Four of us went on Friday to celebrate a friend's birthday.  They have a huge menu & the food was excellent. We shared the potato pancakes & pierogis (potato, potato & cheese, & spinach & potato) for appetizer. Their house salad was delicious - cabbage, cole slaw, beets, carrots & sauerkraut. Everyone enjoyed their entrees:  roast beef with mashed potatoes, chicken meatballs, and the combo platter of kielbasa, pirogues & stuffed cabbage. Their portions are very generous!  We shared 3 blintzes for dessert:  peach, apple & cherry.  I know I speak for all of us when I say we cannot wait to go back real soon!!
The polish food is on point. Just like the food I grew up eating at home.
Delicous homemade Polish food
Excellent foods and place
Everything tastes so good! I go there with my family time to time and it is the best! The breaded porkchop is my absolute favorite! I would 1,000% reccomend this place!
So happy they opened in a new location! Same cook. Great homemade authentic food.
delicious quality soups, perogies, blintzes, many vegetarian options and amazing fresh grated salads.
An elegant small Polish restaurant. I would have given it 5 Stars except for the fact that you can't order a vodka with the outstanding Polish food.
Family owned Polish restaurant, one of the best in the city,.  Everything is really good

I usually have take out or delivery order from this place, so can't tell about service and restaurant itself. But delivery service is fast and always correct, portions are big, food is deliciousssss!!! My friend who lives far away comes to bay ridge specially to eat here))
Excellent pierogies - not dry like a lot of Polish places I've been to. Also great borscht and a very friendly staff.

Two stars for Ukrainian borscht since it was okay. Everything else, food and service, was pretty terrible. My boyfriend and I were looking for comfort food and decided to check out this place. I ordered soup and pirogi, and my boyfriend had chicken cutlet. As mentioned above, soup was okay, but all other food was tasteless and very dry. Pirogi were slightly undercooked too.. I was sick the whole night after eating there.. Now, service... Being completely along in a place, you would expect server to pay some attention to you, but not here. Every time we needed something, we had to call him. He never cleaned our table or checked on us, no water, no bread, nothing.. he brought a check and even though everywhere online it says that they accept major credit cards, he yelled from the corner that they are cash only when we said that we are paying with the card. He didn't even bother getting up. I will never come back. I don't know how this place has good reviews from others.. Absolutely terrible...
Good Polish food in a very small restaurant. The portions are very good sized.
I'm Polish and I think this is the best Polish food I have ever eaten out.   Hungarian Pancake is just delicious!
Perhaps the place doesn't look stunning but the food is very, very good!

Along with the Family Store, this is the brightest gem Bay Ridge has to offer.  The food is authentic, high-quality, and top-notch.  Service is great, and the owner is a *very* good looking Polish woman).  I have a fondness for eastern European food in general, and this restaurant definitely satisfies my cravings!  A few small gripes: First, they should mix up the salads a bit because it gets monotonous to eat the same (excellent) 5 salads (beet salad, coleslaw, sauerkraut, red cabbage, carrot salad) each time.  It's cool the first 2 or 3 times, but by your 5th visit here it's tiring.  Maybe they should only give 2 salads and change up which ones you get.   The 2nd gripe: while you're eating, they use Fantastic to clean the table next to yours with no regard about where the spray goes.  It never fails -- I always get Fantastic up my nose and it ruins dinner for a few minutes.  The last gripe is that they don't accept credit cards; but I suspect this is because they don't need to -- the food is so good that they can be cash-only and still turn a healthy profit.  This a restaurant you *must* go to before you die.  If you go only once, I recommend the Ukrainian Borscht and the Stuffed Kielbasa.  Portion size is huge, but mostly because of the salads.  You won't finish your dinner.  Entrees average about $10.  Here's the low down on the food.  Soups: --------- Sauerkraut: A- Surprisingly good (who would think sauerkraut would be good in soup?).  Tomato: B Not really their fault; I'm not a big fan of tomato soup to begin with.  I'm sure it's good.  Vegetable: B- Easily the worst thing on the menu.  Has a metallic taste to it.  Cucumber:            A+ Ukrainian Borscht: A+ Both soups are perfection.   If you order one of these, you will fall in love with it.  Chicken Soup: B- Disappointing.  Watery and not very interesting.  White Borscht: A You get an egg and mashed potatoes with caramelized onions with it.  Red Borscht with Croquet: B+ It'd be good tasting but a tad boring without the croquet (which is a little like chicken kiev).  Red Borscht with Dumplings: B It would be good tasting but a tad boring without the dumplings.  Barley: B- Sounded good.  Unfortunately, a bit bland and lackluster compared to the borschts.  Bean: B+ Very nice flavor.  Spicy, thick, and hearty.  Good for winter.  Appetizers -------------- Mushroom and Potato Pierogi boiled): A- Spinach and Potato (fried): A- Delicious.   I would recommend getting the sampler.  6 homogeneous pierogi is too much; diversity is better here.  Boiled and fried are equally good.  PETER TIP: Ask the waiter for more caramelized onions...they are DELICIOUS and the pierogi are even better with more onions.  Blintzes ----------- Cheese:      A Strawberry: A Blueberry:   A They are perfection in the guise of blintzes.  The Polonica does not serve dessert, but these dishes would definitely fill that void (but good luck wanting dessert after eating so much!)  Other -------- Potato Pancakes: A Potato Cutlet:        A Again, both dishes are perfection.  I think you get 3 or 4 pancakes which are familiar if you've ever had fried latkes for Chanukah.  The Cutlet is like a Godzilla-sized pancake.  Entres --------- Meatballs:        A- Beef Goulash: A Both delicious and masterfully cooked.  The meatballs are a little like salisbury steak.  Pork Chop (Breaded): B A little plain.  Exactly the "chef's pork chop" minus the cheese.  Chef's Pork Chop: A- The Pork Chop with cheese; the cheese definitely enhances the dish.  Brizol: B A bit dry.  Boiled Pig Hocks: C- Not their fault.  I'm just not a fan of boiled meat period.  Plus, hocks look a little strange to my Western eyes.  They're feet.  Very fatty and not very flavorful.  I'm sure hock-lovers would like it.  Fried Fish: A It may be sole, but you will NOT be disappointed.  I promise you.  Stuffed Kielbasa: A+ A heart attack waiting to happen, but easily the best thing on the menu.  Boiled Cabbage: A Another perfect meal.  Tasty chopped meat and rice inside well cooked cabbage leaves with a very savory tomato sauce.

(Translated by Google) Fantastic greetings from the Mexican jaguars Lizeht de Mejía and Guillermo Mejía Canales and Claudia Mejía Canales @ 1 #?  (Original) nos parese fantástico saludos de los jaguares mexicanos lizeht de Mejía y Guillermo Mejía canales y Claudia Mejía canales @1#?
The food is delightful, flavorful and satisfying. Perogies, steamed or fried, potato pancakes, stuffed cabbage and meatballs all tastes homemade. Go for the food, ignore the sparse decor.
I like your food

Their soups is to die for. I never really have a taste for Eastern European food. But when my friend dragged me here and said you have to try the soup. I was like "meh, fine" I will correct that statement. It was some of the best food and soup I ever had. It a small restaurant so be warned if you have a big group.

Chicken cutlet and potato pancakes are top notch delicious. Ukrainian borscht is almost as good as my 100 year old grandfather's was. Fantastic. We've only had it delivered, the only thing they could do to improve service would be to take plastic. Cash on the barrelhead.

Polish food at its finest!  I have been going here for a long time and I have been happy ever since Good food and good prices for this warm and friendly restaurant.  Go on a date for sure and it can do wonders for you :)  The place is small but cozy..no regrets

Love, love the food!  The stuffed cabbage and Tripe soup are delicious.  The perogies are not bad either.  The people are friendly and the restaurant is small but cozy.  Next door is a great little Polish deli!  Luckily, they deliver to my area in Sunset Park!  Fair pricing.
